text: John Robert Geoffrey Neale (21 September 1926 – 17 July 2020) was a British Anglican bishop. From 1974 to 1988, he was the first suffragan Bishop of Ramsbury in the Church of England and the first area bishop under that diocese's 1981–2009 area scheme.Salisbury Diocesan Synod minutes – 99th session, 7 November 2009 p. 3 (Accessed 23 April 2014) Neale was educated at Felsted School'NEALE, John Robert Geoffrey', Who's Who 2012, A & C Black, 2012; online edition, Oxford University Press, December 2011 , accessed 10 July 2012 and then served in the Royal Artillery during World War II. He completed his studies at King's College London and St Boniface's Warminster, then began his ordained ministry as a curate in St Helier. He was made a deacon on Trinity Sunday 1955 (5 June) and ordained a priest the following Trinity Sunday (27 May 1956) – both times by Bertram Simpson, Bishop of Southwark, at Southwark Cathedral. He was then, successively, the chaplain of Ardingly College, Secretary of the Advisory Council for Church Ministry, Canon Missioner for the Diocese of GuildfordCrockfords Online- accessed 2 December 2008. and Rector of St Peter's Hascombe before his consecration to the episcopate on 24 January 1974 by Michael Ramsey, Archbishop of Canterbury, at Westminster Abbey. From October that year until 1980, he also served as Archdeacon of Wilts in the same diocese. From 1991 he was an assistant bishop in the Diocese of Bristol.Wiltshire Times He died in July 2020, at the age of 93.Bishop John Neale RIP His papers are housed at the National Church Institutions Database of Manuscripts and Archives.NCIDBoMaA ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:20th-century Anglican bishops Category:Alumni of the Theological Department of King's College London Category:Archdeacons of Wilts Category:Associates of King's College Category:Bishops of Ramsbury Category:British Army personnel of World War II Category:People educated at Felsted School Category:Royal Artillery officers
